events.body:
Hmm... seems not to match with your gitian key.

```
pub   4096R/F4316B9B 2015-12-14
      Key fingerprint = B8B3 F1C0 E58C 15DB 6A81  D30C 3648 A882 F431 6B9B
uid                  Marco Falke <falke.marco@gmail.com>
sub   2048R/E50FE137 2015-12-14 [expires: 2016-06-11]
sub   2048R/F6B61B9A 2015-12-14 [expires: 2016-06-11]
```

Matches with first subkey though:

```
pub   4096R/F4316B9B 2015-12-14
      Key fingerprint = B8B3 F1C0 E58C 15DB 6A81  D30C 3648 A882 F431 6B9B
uid                  Marco Falke <falke.marco@gmail.com>
sub   2048R/E50FE137 2015-12-14 [expires: 2016-06-11]
      Key fingerprint = FE09 B823 E6D8 3A3B C798  3EAA 2D7F 2372 E50F E137
sub   2048R/F6B61B9A 2015-12-14 [expires: 2016-06-11]
      Key fingerprint = B6C7 2B4A 758C C29B 483E  82C7 6DF9 EDF1 F6B6 1B9A
```

The important thing is that it matches the key used for signing merges, so if you use the subkey, that one should be in here.
Right. It matches with the first subkey. My fault!

> You need to pass `--fingerprint` twice.

Today I learned!

> The important thing is that it matches the key used for signing merges, so if you use the subkey, that one should be in here.

```
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

I will use the subkeys for everyday signing (gitian results, emails, merge
commits, or this very message I am typing right now, etc) and decryption. The
root key is used to sign other keys or extend the lifetime of the subkeys.
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1

iQEcBAEBAgAGBQJXGNssAAoJEC1/I3LlD+E3BHEH/jIBfm5XiLFH8JZX4RN4j/uS
IsZnJnPlZVZsqrmTFQWR4OYjSfeyGtH3ICxVdbEgkg+T8f709KGi+sJKG3H823W7

zWcGwpKfU4oPLr4UfIAMQx9NGboaDw0rWyM5dki3hJCvy17CGzk3+Ae/I8J7jRGk
1taZwIhtROtMFcDicr629KCA5oGUqjtbXIfmu5cu+Zy5uoL3aC/Q/XukGyC3Gso=
=1Mrt
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
```
